sections.title: Syntax
sections.text_content: Draw.Box (x1, y1, x2, y2, Color : int)

sections.title: Description
sections.raw_content: The Draw.Box procedure is used to draw a box on the screen with bottom left and top right corners of (x1, y1) to (x2, y2) using the specified Color.
sections.text_content: The Draw.Box procedure is used to draw a box on the screen with bottom left and top right corners of (x1, y1) to (x2, y2) using the specified Color.
sections.mdown_content: The **Draw.Box **procedure is used to draw a box on the screen with bottom left and top right corners of (*x1*, *y1*) to (*x2*, *y2*) using the specified *Color*.

sections.title: Example
sections.raw_content: This program draws a large box, reaching to each corner of the screen using color number 12. The maxx and maxy functions are used to determine the maximum x and y values on the screen. The point (0,0) is the left bottom of the screen and (maxx, maxy) is the right top.

sections.title: Details
sections.raw_content: The screen must be in a "graphics" mode. See the View.Set procedure for details. If the screen is not in a "graphics" mode, an error will occur.
